content: Greedy Assume a <= b <= c, so we have two conditions: a + b <= c, then answer is a + b; a + b >= c, then c always choose the larger one of a and b. Finally, a and b will became equal or different by 1. So a and c match k1 times, b and c match k2 times. k1 + k2 = c. The answer should be (k1 + k2) + ((a - k1) + (b - k1)) / 2

content: code class Solution { public: int maximumScore(int a, int b, int c) { int sum = a + b + c; int maxVal = max({a, b, c}); if (sum - maxVal < maxVal) { return sum - maxVal; } else { return sum / 2; } } };
